subject: thread defect n. 2 holes SIMSONN PC Simracing Volante LED Pulsanti Racing Hub
description_text:
Dear Simsonn staff, regarding the above, I would like to inform you that
the product does not live up to its promises. Of the six holes in the
control panel, four are threaded while the other two are not, making it
impossible to properly attach the steering wheel. This defect compromises
the usability of the product, making it unstable and unusable without
additional intervention.
Since I don't want to leave a negative review, given the problem, I would
like to know if you are willing to reach an agreement on a partial refund,
without a refund return the product.
I look forward to hearing from you. Best regards.
Thank you.

ID ordine: 3066086953999551
Order: 11 Dic 2025

Hi Mak P,  This setup is designed to be installed on a 13-inch steering wheel. On the rear side, a 70 mm PCD quick release with threaded holes is required, so the screws can secure the steering wheel + hub + quick release together. The hub itself does not require threads, as it uses through holes.

Hi support Simsonn,
If, as you say, the hub doesn't require threading, I wonder why the other
four through-holes are threaded. Does this mean these four holes are
defective?
Thanks
Best regards

Hi Mak P,  I have reviewed the video you provided. In fact, there is no difference between the two holes—they are both through holes. If the holes are tapped, the screw cannot pass straight through to the other side; it must be screwed in.
